bestBHT.bht: Some openly declared Jesus to be the Messiah, while others denied it based on the fact that He came from Galilee. They questioned, Shall Christ come out of Galilee? Yet, it is clear that their understanding of the Messiah was limited. In our present day, we must not be surprised by the divisions and controversies that arise among those who claim to be God's people. However, we should not be indifferent to the profound truths of the heavenly kingdom. Jesus, the true Messiah, spoke of rivers of living water flowing from Him.

Marvin Vincent: What, doth the Christ come, etc. The idea in full is, 'you cannot say that, for doth the Christ, etc.'"
The present tense. Rev., rightly, doth - come.
John Calvin: By this example we are warned that we ought not to think it strange in the present day, if men are divided among themselves by various controversies.
There is no reason, therefore, why our consciences should be distressed, when we see those who wish to be accounted the people of God fighting with each other by contrary opinions.
In matters of little consequence we are ashamed of being indolent, while, in the mysteries of the heavenly kingdom, we slumber without any concern.
Archibald T. Robertson: These went further and dared to call Jesus the Messiah and not merely the prophet who might not be the Messiah. They said it openly."
These denied that Jesus was the Messiah and gave as their reason (γαρ, for) the fact that he came from Galilee.
The use of μη expects a negative answer.
John Gill: The true Messiah...from his speaking of rivers of living water flowing from him that believes in him.
But some said, shall Christ come out of Galilee?
For if they did not mean this, according to their own accounts, the Messiah was to be in Galilee, and to be first revealed there.

bhtAttempts.bht: Some openly declared Jesus to be the Messiah while others denied it based on the fact that He came from Galilee. They questioned, Shall Christ come out of Galilee? Yet, it is clear that their understanding of the Messiah was limited. In our present day, we must not be surprised by the divisions and controversies that arise among those who claim to be God's people. However, we should not be indifferent or apathetic when it comes to the profound truths of the heavenly kingdom. Jesus, the true Messiah, spoke of rivers of living water flowing from Him. Even by their own accounts, the Messiah was to be in Galilee and first revealed there.

Some openly declared Jesus to be the Messiah, while others denied it based on the fact that He came from Galilee. They questioned, Shall Christ come out of Galilee? Yet, it is clear that their understanding of the Messiah was limited. In our present day, we must not be surprised by the divisions and controversies that arise among those who claim to be God's people. However, we should not be indifferent to the profound truths of the heavenly kingdom. Jesus, the true Messiah, spoke of rivers of living water flowing from Him.

Some boldly declared Jesus as the Messiah, while others rejected this notion, arguing that the Christ could not come from Galilee. However, their understanding of the Messiah was flawed. In our own time, it is not surprising to witness divisions and debates among those who consider themselves God's people. But let us not be indifferent when it comes to heavenly matters. Jesus, the true Messiah, promised rivers of living water to flow through those who believe in Him.

Some confidently proclaimed Jesus to be the Messiah, while others disregarded this claim, using His Galilean origin as a basis for their denial. However, their limited understanding prevented them from recognizing the truth. In our present day, we should not be surprised by disputes and disagreements among those who identify as God's people. Nevertheless, we must not be passive about matters pertaining to the mysteries of the heavenly realm. Jesus, the genuine Messiah, spoke of abundant spiritual blessings flowing from those who have faith in Him.

While some boldly acknowledged Jesus as the Messiah, others questioned His Galilean roots, dismissing Him as the chosen one. Their limited understanding hindered them from recognizing the truth. In our current era, divisions and controversies among those who claim to be God's people should not come as a surprise. Nevertheless, we should not be indifferent to the profound mysteries of the heavenly kingdom. Jesus, the true Messiah, spoke of a continuous outpouring of living water from those who believe in Him.
